pkgmetadata.longdescription: # datadispatchdatadispatch provides a dispatch mechanism (a.k.a. polymorphism) like `functools.singledispatch`, but it operates on data instead of types. This is useful if you are creating simple data-centric applications where you want polymorphism Ã la carte without resorting to types or classes.datadispatch is available through pip: `pip install datadispatch`## Usage example```pythonfrom datadispatch import datadispatch@datadispatch(lambda args, _: args[0].get('type'))def handle(message): raise ValueError('cannot handle message: {}'.format(message))@handle.register('ping')def _(message): return 'you sent ping'@handle.register('pong')def _(message): return 'you sent pong'print(handle( {'type': 'ping', 'payload': 'hello'}))```
